definition: Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss or Sukhavati (Sanskrit)
pinyin: xi1 fang1 ji2 le4 shi4 jie4

sentences.english: With him as my key I was able to unlock another world, a happier land.
sentences.chinese: 他是我打開另一個極樂世界的鑰匙。

sentences.english: E.g. Amitabha Buddha (Amituofo) has infinite life for helping countless beings in Pure Land.
sentences.chinese: 無量佛陀在極樂世界無窮盡的生命普度衆生。

sentences.english: The judges say I have to go now to Elysium and that it will be nice there. I miss my family.
sentences.chinese: 法官們說我現在可以去極樂世界，那裏會很美好。

sentences.english: They put on their headphones, drape a hood over their head and drift off into the world of "digital highs".
sentences.chinese: 他們戴上耳機，裹住頭部，沉溺於“數碼極樂世界”。

sentences.english: A small niche in the rear houses Amitabha of Sukhavati (Land of Ultimate Bliss).
sentences.chinese: 後面小洞內供西方極樂世界阿彌陀佛。

sentences.english: The inscription of 'Extreme Happiness' behind the hill is in the handwriting of Emperor QianLong.
sentences.chinese: 在山後掛着“極樂世界”字樣御筆親書的金匾。

sentences.english: Is Elysium there are joy and sadness?
sentences.chinese: 極樂世界是有快樂和悲傷的嗎？

sentences.english: Those fairy forms of bliss Elysian.
sentences.chinese: 那些極樂世界的仙女們。

sentences.english: I don't think that human's ultimate goal is to be immortal and live in the Elysian Fields.
sentences.chinese: 我不認爲人類的終極目標就是在極樂世界中永生。

sentences.english: Or should I not think about anything while chanting Amitabha Buddha?
sentences.chinese: 念阿彌陀佛，迴向自己往生西方極樂世界。

definition: Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss or Sukhavati (Sanskrit)
pinyin: xi1 fang1 ji2 le4 shi4 jie4

definition: to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
Amitabha Buddha/the Buddha of the Western paradise/may the lord Buddha preserve us!/merciful Buddha!
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
to untie/to free/to absolve of/to get free of/to extirpate oneself/(Buddhism) to free oneself of worldly worries
to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
(Buddhism) Pure Land, usually refers to Amitabha Buddha's Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss (Sukhavati in Sanskrit)
